column4: if you want to get rid of grub you must replace it with something else, if you want to install windows, you must replace with the windows MBR, for that matter you must use a windows uility, fdisk /mbr or fixmbr
please ask on ##windows, your question is not ubuntu related
do a sudo fdisk -l (to see what is the partition name)
if it does not mount, the filesystem is corrupted or not of the type you are expecting, please check with fdisk -l first
sudo fdisk -l /dev/sdb says it is sdb5, as did gparted, and it's on an extended partition.
if you can't mount id, and its listed as ext3, then it's probably corrupted

It is listed as unrecognized, and I *know* it is ext3, since I left it when I upgraded to jaunty the other day.  / and /home are on different partitions, / is ext4, /home is ext3, only thing I can think of is that it is on an extended partition, and there is empty space infront of it, not sure if that could be doing it
you could try to use testdisk, to check for a deleted partition entry
I don't think it's deleted, since it shows up, just as unrecognized.
so it's corrupted...
Yes, as stated, and I was asking for either help mounting it or help fscking it
I mean, seriously corrupted, since you can't fsck it...
I realize that, but do you know of anything I can try?  I tried SpinRite, it sees it, but says it doesn't think it can successfully read/write to it, so it doesn't want to try
I would try testdisk anyway

You know of a more or less reliable way I can at least get one last read out of it?  Running testdisk now, not sure how long it should take, I selected the drive, and did proceed, not sure when the "fixing" comes into play.
if it's seriously corrupted, forget it

So since it's corrupted, and I have a replacement drive, and have accepted that the data is gone, you can't suggest anything to try with a spare drive I have that had my former /home on it?  I mean it's gone either way, so what's the difference?
I mean if there is a slight chance I can get it back, why not try it?
I don't have the know-how for such a recovery attempt, sorry
ath5k is a free driver, why would it need restricted drivers manager?
because it allows yo swap between the madwifi and ath5k which is disabled because it introduces problems with some models
actually it is just called, hardware drivers dialog
